OOC: I guess my wireless connection crapped out on me before I got it. Sorr=
y, has a habit of doing that.  

BIC: 

The faint voice had raised a very i=
mportant point.  Was he ready to face the answers come what may.  He smiles=
 and makes room for Lord Elder beside him.  A very gentile look comes over =
his face.

" A voice asked me a very important question.  A question about =
self worth, and how my choices define me. I admit, it's a hard one to answe=
r.  Because to me Lord Elder, innocent lives are worth far more than my own=
.  I don't lust for power, instead, I wish for it to be shared with those w=
ho desperately need it.  So yes, if I had to die for the innocent, I would.=
  I would risk my life to save those of others.  So my self worth...  My se=
lf worth can never compare to the lives of future generations who depend on=
 those who are willing to put their hearts into fighting for them.  And if =
I could do something that could make a definite difference, it would be to =
help the Decepticons who have been abandoned by their so called faction, an=
d try to give them a sense of belonging.  Good or evil, Decepticon, Predaco=
n, Autobot or Maximal all lives are precious and can never hold a price to =
them."

He puts a hand on Lord Elder's Shoulder.

" That goes for you too, =
Lord Elder."

He then turns to Kup.

" Yes Kup, I'd really like to know how=
 this all happened.  Only then can I get a better understanding as to why R=
odimus was unable to resist the enemy."  

He turns his attention back to L=
ord Elder.

" I wish I didn't have to wait so long for Optimus to re awaken=
. But a voice just gave me the advice I've been meaning to hear for a long =
time.  Ughhh....  Uh ohh, energy's down again.  I - think I need a recharge=
.

He stumbles while getting to his feet.



--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com,=
 Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> >
> > " I do promise you so=
mething Optimus Prime, even through thoughts of betrayal, I will never turn=
 a blind eye on my Autobot comrade, even though, anger almost made me think=
 otherwise. I have to curb my temper, I'm aware of that. Unless I know the =
story from Rodimus's point of view I will not judge him as you have taught =
me. Innocent until proven guilty. Well, that's about it Optimus, I haven't =
much more to tell you or to ask of you. May you rest peacefully in the arms=
 of Primus himself."
> >
> > He gets back up onto his feet, and salutes Opt=
imus Prime.
> 
> The large body body of Optimus Prime continued to lay ther=
e as cold
> and lifeless as it has always been. The Maximals and Autobots a=
re tiny
> compared to their massive forms. Nothing moves in this chamber ex=
cept
> the Maximals and Autobots, and sound itself seems dull and colorless=
.
> It is a mausoleum to victory and death, and the futility of both.
> 
> =
"Freedom creates the opportunity for choice, yet not all choices can
> be e=
asily discerned." came a whisper, one that only Tuscon could hear.
>  "Our =
choices are often made according to our sense of our own worth.
> Young Tus=
con, what are you worth? How do your choices define you?"
> 
> "Somethings =
still lie beyond your ability to see.You may find your
> answers more perpl=
exing than your questions." It is almost as if hands
> were laid on Tuscon'=
s shoulders, "Are you ready for it for the answers
> you will recieve?"
> 
=
> The sensation of hands fade into nothing, "You are almost there Tuscon, r=
est."
> 
> Lord Elder walked up as the voice faded from Tuscon, he looked o=
ver at
> Optimus, not quite daring to lay a hand on a foot nearly as large =
as
> he was. "He will rise again. It is unfortunate that it won't be for so=

> many years."
>

as well :)
